reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We normally visit the hotel in February and October,but this year we decided to visit in May.The hotel attracts lots of residents who are golfers.In the past this has not been a problem at all.However ,we were very disappointed in the loutish behavoiur of some golfers during our last holiday.We were woken up most mornings between 3.00-6.00 am when drunken,loutish golfers were returning from their nights out.They showed no consideration for fellow guests.Breakfast time was not a pleasant and relaxed affair ,spoilt by golfers who were loudly bragging about their exploits on and off the golf courses.Each evening we went to eat out around the Marina and the yobbish golfers spoilt the ambiance by their shouting and drunken behaviour.Football supporters get a bad press for their behaviour but I am sorry to say that Vilamoura was spoilt for us by golfing yobs.Could it be that the gentlemen of golf avoid the summer months?
reviews.title: Yobbish golfers

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked a seaview superior room and on arrival found it to be clean and reasonably furnished, The staff at the hotel (reception/cleaning/bar/dining) were very helpfull and could not look after us any better. The hotel is located within a 2-3 minute walk from the marina which is particularly spectacular. There are some super places to eat on the marina which all have spectacular views. Eating out in Vilamoura is not cheap but you are on holiday and every meal we had was 1st class. The beach in front of the hotel was very clean and had sunbeds and parasols for hire.
reviews.title: Superb location but with noisy neighbours

likes.disliked: — 3 nights of noise from the disco next door (midnight -6.30am)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008
reviews.text: The breakfast menu had a good choice for all diets and taste buds. We had dinner in the hotel restaurant 1 night and were pleased with the buffet menu which cost us 20 euros each. The 2 pools (1 adult & 1 child) were clean but not heated. There was entertainment every night but this was nothing to write home about.
reviews.title: Brilliant

likes.liked: — The small balconny where you sit out and relax

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: The first 3 nights we stayed (Mon, Tue, and wed) were very peaceful, however on the thursday night / Friday morning at 12.30am we were disturbed to hear loud bass music that vibrated the patio windows! On investigation it was found to be coming from Black Jacks (a casino nightclub next door). This obtrusive noise did not strop until 6.30AM, as if this was not bad enough we had to stand this for the next 2 nights. This is a weekly occurrance so we found out next morning, every Thursday , Friday & Saturday so beware and make sure that you request a room that is not on the far wing nearest the casino. We did voice our complaints but we obviously didn't make enough noise as we did not get moved. We spoke to other residents who were also disturbed by the noise and they were moved to a suite (these are a good distance from the casino). Having said all this we would return to the hotel but we would request a room away from the casino. We researched the hotel on trip advisor before booking but nobody has ever mentioned the noise before, but we feel that prospective residents should be made aware of the disco.
reviews.title: pleasantly surprised

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: This was our 1st visit to The Algarve and we were very pleased that we chose Vilamoura. To summarise: super location, spectacular views, friendly staff, high quality restauants in vilamoura.
reviews.title: rude staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: This is the second time we stayed at the Vila Gale and this year we took our daughter, son-in-law (+his parents) and 7 month old grand daughter. We had a fantastic time and cannot fault the hotel at all. Make sure you book a sea view with balcony as some of the rooms without sea views are small and dingy. It would be nice if the hotel could provide tea/coffee making facilities as we only stayed on bed and breakfast basis. The location is absolutely fantastic for the beach and the marina. We ate out every night and only heard the late night music once. If you keep your doors shut you cannot hear anything!!
reviews.title: Brilliant!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: The children's pool could benefit from markings on the bottom of the pool to show the different levels as several parents 'slipped' due to the difference in levels.
reviews.title: A lovely hotel in a superb location

likes.liked: — Our Suite on the 8th floor and the stunning views

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: We walked to Quarteria one evening - don't do it!! It was an awful place with loads of cheap bars/cafes and no where decent to eat.
reviews.title: Awful

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled solo
reviews.text: We would definitley recommend this hotel as it was clean, comfortable and the staff very friendly and helpful.
reviews.title: Nice Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: Having read the other reviews I was a little concerned about staying at the hotel as we had our 4 year old daughter with us.
reviews.title: Deffo return

likes.disliked: — nikki beach, price of sunbeds, and reservation of loungers

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed there for 4 nights. The hotel was very nice, the food was fantastic and the room was clean. The location couldn’t be better for both beach and Vilamoura.
reviews.title: Nice hotel ruined by noise

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Unfortunately our stay was ruined by the noise from Nikki Beach, an outdoor nightclub that has recently opened literally opposite the hotel in the grounds of the adjacent Tivoli Marinotel pumping out loud dance music until past 2am every night and until about 5am on Friday night. Admittedly our room was facing Nikki Beach, but most of the rooms are, and all the rooms with a view to the beach will be affected by the noise.
reviews.title: Good and Bad

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We did complain to the manager at Nikki beach, but they informed us they do have a license until 2am (which they seem to ignore).
reviews.title: Enjoyed our holiday

likes.disliked: — Temperature of swimming pool water/towels reserving sunbeds

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Basically, the hotel is great, but if you’re hoping to go to sleep before 3am don’t stay at this hotel. The noise was incredibly intrusive and relentless.
reviews.title: Very Overated 4 Star Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: In general an excellant hotel, the check in staff were friendly and helpfull, although we had 3 rooms in the first 4 hours of check in.
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel

likes.liked: — great rooms and staff, great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Jusr returned fram a 7 night stay Hotel was very clean and staff very polite and helpful Good location on beech and next to marina Would recommend
reviews.title: Good Hotel nice and friendly

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here for 7 nights in September. Large hotel beside the beach and not far from marina where all the restaurants are, so what more could we ask for. The room on first impressions was ok, but when you've stayed there a few days you start to notice that it wasn't very clean, with dirty marks on the walls and stains on furniture, bathroom was ok, there was a small kitchen which left a lot to be desired we didn't eat or prepare anything in it. We had breakfast included in our rate, which was ok and the staff weren't overfriendly either. The hotel did have a pool but we stayed away as it was overcrowded and by 7am towels were already on the sunbeds, although the hotel did not allow this. The resort itself seemed nice but when we went out mostly everyone we encountered in restaurants and shops were very rude and couldn't be bothered serving us. We wouldn't return to Vilamoura and if we did we wouldn't stay at the Vila Gale considering the price we paid. The only plus side was that the hotel was right on the beach.
reviews.title: Disappointed Overall

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just returned from a week at the Vila Gale Ampalius, and we were very happy with our experience. The hotel looks very modern in the reception area but some aspects need a bit of updating, i.e our bathroom could have done with a bit of a spruce up. However our room was a good size with a great balcony and seaview, as we had requested, and was cleaned adequately every day. The room had a full size fridge in a little kitchen area which was great for chilling the wine that we drank sitting on the balcony whilst watching the sun set. Big bonus was the weather !
reviews.title: Great Place for a Winter Break

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Sun every day and temperatures in the 70's, just what we needed at the end of a British February.
reviews.title: Excellent location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great breakfast buffet with plenty of choice of both hot and cold food. Lots of golfers use this hotel and they were all making the most of the breakfast before hitting the fairways.
reviews.title: Christmas at the Ampalius

likes.liked: — Location , views - good standard of room
likes.disliked: — After two weeks the food could be repertious
